TopicTitle: [1.3.1] Pood's OPM-VO (Outer Planets Mod - Visual Overhaul) [v0.3.5] [2017-09-23]

Articles.Content: Haha, yeah chuck your Output log and KSP log up for me to check with anything else you may think is handy and I'll take a look. I can't have your Space Programme telescope images coming back with errors due to faulty CCD sensors.

could not reproduce >_>

it must have just been my eyes falling half closed with tiredness causing the dimming
How do I download the new version for is 1.2?

So... any plan for 1.2? 'cause it looks goodandawesomeandIwanttotryitnowANDITSBEATIFULPLEASPLEASEPLEASE *gets hit*

More seriously... do you have a plan for CKAN compatibility?
2 weeks and no reply? Is this mod dead? I truly hope not.
I really hope this isnt going to die as a mod. Would be a real shame.

On 11/27/2016 at 11:07 PM, Poodmund said:

Just working on a 1.2.1 compatibility patch and it seems we're back in business boys and girls!  

I'm going to be concentrating on getting a working version out for dev. release first then I'll go in and touch up a lot of the Scatterer configs. With the new Scatterer config syntax now, it means the whole mod can be located inside its own mod folder so it can be very easily CKAN compatible for those that use it, hurrah!

Calm down all, jeez! 

I have some time off over the Xmas Holiday period. Safe to say something will most likely be out before I head back to work around 10th Jan.
It's Jan 11th. Was there any progress?
might be waiting on a final version of the ring shader....
I've come full circle, all other planetary mods are outdated, so I will play stock with OPM, now I just have to get this and I'll be all set

On 1/12/2017 at 2:53 AM, Drew Kerman said:

might be waiting on a final version of the ring shader....

You've pretty much hit the nail on the head; waiting on the next releases of Scatterer and Kopernicus.
yea figured, since Galileo was (is?) waiting on the same thing. He has a new release aimed for tomorrow but that may be unrelated to work needed for updated Scatterer/Kopernicus configs

12 hours ago, Poodmund said:

You've pretty much hit the nail on the head; waiting on the next releases of Scatterer and Kopernicus.

Thanks for letting us know!

Can't wait
I'm really curious for when this will be up and ready, it's either OPM or SSRSS a this point, but right now SSRSS appears to be the favourite.
I'm using the 1.1.2 version in 1.2.1, It's better than nothing!
Is the 1.1.2 version working with 1.2.2?

On 16.1.2017 at 7:47 PM, Poodmund said:

You've pretty much hit the nail on the head; waiting on the next releases of Scatterer and Kopernicus.

Since Kopernicus and Scatterer are now both 1.2.2 compatible... can you already give us an update?

No pressure, please take your time to make it right, I am just curious
I'm on holiday at the moment but will look to getting it sorted soon after I return.

Okay, I'm going to be THAT guy and ask... When is holiday over?

Regardless, hope you have/had a good one!

9 minutes ago, Rhedd said:

Okay, I'm going to be THAT guy and ask... When is holiday over?

Regardless, hope you have/had a good one!

When scatterer gets some fixes and kopernicus gets is ring shader fixed.. nearly all visual pack developers are at a stand still

Weren't those both fixed and updated some time ago? Isn't that why Poodmund said he'd start when he got back from holiday? Isn't his (certainly well-deserved) holiday the only thing we're waiting on at this point?

Hope I don't sound rude. I'm just trying to figure out where in the process we're at. Lots of things that depend on other things!

Edited February 11, 2017 by Rhedd

I recently returned from holiday, yes, but as Galileo has stated there is an issue with Scatterer at the moment that affects systems with multiple bodies that have rings... this certainly affects OPM as we have Sarnus and Urlum that both have ring systems.

Blackrack is aware of the issue and we will just have to wait patiently until a fix is found, solved and implemented into a new Scatterer release. Sorry guys, please be patient.

Dependencies!  Sometimes they drive you mad but where would we be without them; nowhere, that's where.
How does this  compare to SVE for performance? My system is just barely able to run with SVE low resolution at around 10 FPS with all my other mods....

Its kind of irrelevant seeing as if you wanted the stock system to use EVE/Scatterer etc. you'd also need to download and run a mod for the stock planets. This mod only applies effects to the OPM bodies. Any performance issues will pertain if using Stock EVE/SVE/KSPRC or a similar pack.

13 hours ago, Rhedd said:

Okay, I'm going to be THAT guy and ask... When is holiday over?

I was just resisting being you earlier today. Bummer about the new ring issue. So it goes! At least we know it'll eventually get patched up
